On 8/25/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> > This featur=
e was requested by users who do tests that are allowed to
> fail
> > for a =
certain threshold, such as sending packets on an unreliable
> network.
>
> =
It seems the context is different. The Original Poster appeared to be
> ask=
ing about failing a build only if, say, 5% of the suite's tests
> failed. T=
hat's quite a bit different from the feature you mention here,
> which woul=
d help with your example as well as statistical kinds of
> testing for rand=
omness, that kind of thing.


Ah, I stand corrected if such is the case.

I=
 can see some value in deciding that certain specific tests are "less
impor=
tant" than others and it's okay if they go broken for a little while,
but I=
 certainly don't understand how it could be acceptable to say "any 5%
of my=
 entire test suite can fail"...

I would love to get a clarification from t=
he original poster...
